column4: Did you get gsynaptic from the Debian repos.. and trying to use in Feisty?
I got GSynaptic from the Synaptic Package manager
What sources list did you add/change .. I dont see it in mine
I just used the search tool to found GSynaptic on the Package Manager. I can get a screen grab if you need it?
Post your sources.lst on the pastebin.. that would be more helpful
Where would I find the file?
My fault...  I was on a dapper system.. it is in my feisty system
Pici: Any ideas without the 'broken' log?
Or sudo nano and restore your old xorg from a backup
Are you referring to restoring an old xorg.conf file?
If the xorg.conf file is broken, then why would it run 1 out 5 times?
All I can think of is an init of your gsynaptic touchapd or whatever it is.
